title: NASA’s SpaceX 32nd Resupply Mission Launches New Research to Station
summary: NASA and SpaceX are launching the company’s 32nd commercial resupply services mission to the International Space Station later this month, bringing a host of new research to the orbiting laboratory. Aboard the SpaceX Dragon spacecraft are experiments focused on vision-based navigation, spacecraft air quality, materials for drug and product manufacturing, and advancing plant growth with […]

title: NASA Webb’s Autopsy of Planet Swallowed by Star Yields Surprise
summary: Observations from NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope have provided a surprising twist in the narrative surrounding what is believed to be the first star observed in the act of swallowing a planet. title: Pangea Aerospace Secures €7.27M to Develop its Aerospike Engine
summary:
A consortium that includes Pangea Aerospace has secured €7.27 million in funding from the Spanish government to complete the development of its ARCOS aerospike engine. title: NASA Offers Free High School Engineering Program This Summer
summary: NASA’s Glenn Research Center in Cleveland is launching the NASA Glenn High School Engineering Institute this summer.
